techmeme.title: The EU's General Court backs Google's challenge against the EU's €1.49B antitrust fine, imposed in 2019 for hindering rivals in online search ads (Foo Yun Chee/Reuters)
How a trademark fight led to a new version of Flappy Bird by a crypto-adjacent game developer, ten years after the original was pulled from app stores (Kyle Orland/Ars Technica)
India, which has set aside $11B for its semiconductor mission, is obsessing over self-reliance instead of focusing on areas that can be scaled up quickly (Mihir Sharma/Bloomberg)
Apple pulls the iPadOS 18 update for M4 iPad Pro models after bricking complaints as the company works "to resolve an issue impacting a small number of devices" (Juli Clover/MacRumors)
Intel's decision to delay new Germany and Poland plants by two years is a blow to the EU's goal of making 20% of the world's chips by 2030, up from ~9% in 2022 (Pieter Haeck/Politico)
